author: Jonathan Cheng
title: South Korean President Hopes Olympics Will Prompt U.S. Dialogue With North
text:
PYEONGCHANG, South Koreaâ€”South Korean President Moon Jae-in said Saturday that he remained hopeful that a recent inter-Korean rapprochement around the Olympics could lead to dialogue between the U.S. and North Korea, even as Pyongyang reiterated it had no intention of seeking talks with Washington.
During a visit to the Pyeongchang Olympics on Saturday, Mr. Moon also said that it was still too early to discuss a possible trip to Pyongyang.
